metadata.feature_description: Create, edit, and manage activity stream posts with various content types and privacy settings

steps.expected: Activity stream with post creation area visible
steps.actual: Activity Feed page loaded with post creation area showing 'Tell the world something...' placeholder

steps.action: Click on post area and type text 'This is a test post for Activity Stream testing'
steps.expected: Text appears in the post creation area
steps.actual: Text entered successfully in the editable area

steps.action: Click Share button to publish the post
steps.expected: Post appears in the activity feed
steps.actual: Post created successfully and appears at the top of the activity feed

steps.action: Type text with emojis in post area
steps.expected: Emoji characters accepted in post content
steps.actual: Emoji text entered. Initial longer text exceeded max length, shorter text 'Emoji test' with emojis accepted

steps.action: Attempt to post longer emoji text
steps.expected: Error message if exceeds maximum length
steps.actual: Error displayed: 'Text exceeds the maximum length' - validation working correctly
Post 'Emoji test' with grinning and thumbsup emojis created and displayed in feed

steps.expected: Post created with special characters preserved
steps.actual: Post 'Special chars: @#$%&*()!' created successfully and displayed in feed with all special characters intact

steps.action: Click Remove link on a post
steps.actual: Confirmation dialog displayed asking 'Are you sure you want to delete this post?'
Post deleted successfully and no longer visible in the activity feed

steps.action: Enter HTML script tag in post: <script>alert('XSS')</script>
steps.expected: Script tag stripped or escaped when post is created
steps.actual: Script tag entered in post creation area

steps.action: Submit the post and verify content
steps.expected: Malicious script tag removed, only safe content displayed
steps.actual: Script tag completely stripped - post shows 'HTML test' text only, no script content visible. XSS attack prevented.

steps.expected: Empty post area ready for testing
steps.actual: Post area cleared, showing placeholder text

steps.action: Click Share button without entering any text
steps.expected: System should prevent empty post creation with validation error
steps.actual: DEFECT: Empty post was created and displayed in feed with no content - only username and timestamp visible

issues: Empty post validation missing - system allows creation of posts with no content. This should be blocked with a validation message.

steps.action: Expand post creation area and view UI elements
steps.expected: Post creation UI with privacy options visible
steps.actual: Post creation area expanded showing Share button and toolbar icons including email, emoji, camera, attachment, and eye (privacy) icon
Privacy dropdown displayed with 'Who will see this?' header and four options: Everyone (default), Community Members, Friends, Private

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Create post with Friends privacy level

steps.action: Select Friends privacy option and enter post text
steps.expected: Friends option selected and text entered
steps.actual: Friends radio button selected, text 'Friends only post test' entered in post area

steps.action: Click Share to create post with Friends privacy
steps.actual: Post 'Friends only post test' created successfully and appears in feed

observations: Code confirms security sets support: E=Everyone, C=Community Members, F=Friends, U=User (Private), R=Role/Group
HTML sanitization is implemented via Utilities.FilterMaliciousTags() method in ActivityStreamServicesController.cs
Maximum character length is enforced via SettingsHelper.MaxCommentLength() - error message displayed when exceeded
Profanity filter support exists in code (FilterContent, ProhibitContent modes) but was not tested as no profanity words are configured
User mentions feature exists in code (UserMentionsController.Instance.ReplaceUserMentionsWithToken) but was not visible in UI during testing
Edit post functionality exists in code but no Edit option was found in the post action links (only Like, Comment, Unsubscribe, Remove, Pin visible)
